greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 0, a(n) = sum of divisors d of n such that if d = Product_(i) (p_i^e_i) then all e_i are <= 1.
comment: a(n) = sum of non-powerful divisors d of n where powerful numbers are numbers from A001694(m) for m >=2.
Sequence is not the same as A183101(n): a(72) = 65, A183101(72) = 137.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16385
Index entries for sequences related to sums of divisors
formula: a(1) = 0, a(p) = p, a(pq) = p+q+pq, a(pq...z) = [(p+1)*(q+1)*…*(z+1)]-1, a(p^k) = p, for p, q = primes, k = natural numbers, pq...z = product of k (k > 2) distinct primes p, q, ..., z.
example: For n = 12, set of such divisors is {2, 3, 6, 12}; a(12) = 2+3+6+12 = 23.
program: (PARI) A183098(n) = sumdiv(n, d, d*(!ispowerful(d))); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 07 2017
results.author: _Jaroslav Krizek_, Dec 25 2010
